Human Resource Officer Job at Officemakers International Limited




        
    

        
        Officemakers International Limited specializes in providing tailored recruitment solutions in Graduate and Professional Recruitment, Executive Search & Selection, Non Executive Recruitment, Background Checks and lots more.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Officer
Job Location: Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Brief
     

            
    




	Managing the full employee lifecycle, focusing on recruiting licensed agents, onboarding them, ensuring compliance with real estate laws, developing performance systems for sales, handling employee relations for high-pressure roles, and implementing training for market knowledge and ethics, all while managing budgets, HRIS, and strategic workforce planning for sales, leasing, and property management teams.


Key Responsibilities


	Key skills include labor law knowledge, strong negotiation, data analysis, leadership, and confidentiality.


Requirements


	HND / BSc in HR, Business Administration, or related field.
	3–5 years of HR experience (experience in the real estate sector is an advantage).
	Strong communication, organisational, and interpersonal skills.
	Knowledge of labour laws and HR best practices.
	Must be a female.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 + Benefits.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cv@officemakersng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Tax Manager",
  "description": "Saroafrica Nigeria Limited (&lsquo;Saro&rsquo;) is an indigenous private sector player with 3 decades of experience in Nigeria. Saro has five Subsidiaries (Saro Agrosciences, Saro Lifecare, Saro Agro-Allied, Gossy Warm Spring and Saro Oil Palm) and two Joint Ventures (AgriseedCo and Green Hills Agricultural Products). Saroafrica is set to become a leading consumer, manufacturing, FMCG and integrated agricultural value chain group. In pursuit of this ambition Saroafrica is making significant investment in a Palm Plantation and Cassava to Ethanol Plant.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Tax Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Tax Manager is a strategic business partner in ensuring the business compliance with all applicable tax laws, financial regulations, and statutory requirements.
	He/she is charged with managing tax filings, liaising with regulatory authorities, monitoring compliance obligations, and providing strategic advice to minimize tax risks while optimizing efficiency.


Duties / Responsibilities
Tax Compliance:


	Developing and implementing Business Tax Strategies that will support the overall Strategic focus of the business
	Ensure timely payment of all tax liabilities and reconciliation with financial records.
	Maintain proper documentation for tax audits and respond to queries from tax authorities.
	Monitor changes in tax laws and regulations, advising management on implications for the business.
	Support tax planning initiatives to optimize the organization&rsquo;s tax position.
	Liaise with regulators, external auditors, and tax consultants as required.
	Conduct regular tax compliance reviews and risk assessments to identify potential gaps.
	Maintain an up-to-date compliance calendar and ensure adherence to filing deadlines.


Reporting &amp; Advisory:


	Provide periodic reports to management on tax exposures, compliance risks, and regulatory updates.
	Advise business units on compliance requirements for transactions, contracts, and projects.
	Support internal stakeholders with regulatory interpretations and compliance guidance.


Qualifications / Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or related field.
	Minimum of 7 years of relevant experience in tax and regulatory compliance, preferably in a corporate or professional services environment.
	Professional qualifications (ACA, ACCA, CITN) are an added advantage.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian tax laws and regulatory frameworks.
	Proficiency in MS Excel and accounting software is desirable.
	Age Requirement: Not more than 40 years.


Competencies and Skills Required:


	Excellent knowledge of tax compliance, regulatory reporting, and statutory requirements.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	High attention to detail and accuracy.
	Good communication and stakeholder management skills.
	Ability to work independently and meet tight deadlines.
	Strong ethics and integrity.

Tax Manager Job at SaroAfrica International Limited




        
    

        
        Saroafrica Nigeria Limited (‘Saro’) is an indigenous private sector player with 3 decades of experience in Nigeria. Saro has five Subsidiaries (Saro Agrosciences, Saro Lifecare, Saro Agro-Allied, Gossy Warm Spring and Saro Oil Palm) and two Joint Ventures (AgriseedCo and Green Hills Agricultural Products). Saroafrica is set to become a leading consumer, manufacturing, FMCG and integrated agricultural value chain group. In pursuit of this ambition Saroafrica is making significant investment in a Palm Plantation and Cassava to Ethanol Plant.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Tax Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Job Summary


	The Tax Manager is a strategic business partner in ensuring the business compliance with all applicable tax laws, financial regulations, and statutory requirements.
	He/she is charged with managing tax filings, liaising with regulatory authorities, monitoring compliance obligations, and providing strategic advice to minimize tax risks while optimizing efficiency.


Duties / Responsibilities
Tax Compliance:


	Developing and implementing Business Tax Strategies that will support the overall Strategic focus of the business
	Ensure timely payment of all tax liabilities and reconciliation with financial records.
	Maintain proper documentation for tax audits and respond to queries from tax authorities.
	Monitor changes in tax laws and regulations, advising management on implications for the business.
	Support tax planning initiatives to optimize the organization’s tax position.
	Liaise with regulators, external auditors, and tax consultants as required.
	Conduct regular tax compliance reviews and risk assessments to identify potential gaps.
	Maintain an up-to-date compliance calendar and ensure adherence to filing deadlines.


Reporting & Advisory:


	Provide periodic reports to management on tax exposures, compliance risks, and regulatory updates.
	Advise business units on compliance requirements for transactions, contracts, and projects.
	Support internal stakeholders with regulatory interpretations and compliance guidance.


Qualifications / Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or related field.
	Minimum of 7 years of relevant experience in tax and regulatory compliance, preferably in a corporate or professional services environment.
	Professional qualifications (ACA, ACCA, CITN) are an added advantage.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian tax laws and regulatory frameworks.
	Proficiency in MS Excel and accounting software is desirable.
	Age Requirement: Not more than 40 years.


Competencies and Skills Required:


	Excellent knowledge of tax compliance, regulatory reporting, and statutory requirements.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	High attention to detail and accuracy.
	Good communication and stakeholder management skills.
	Ability to work independently and meet tight deadlines.
	Strong ethics and integrity.

	Facilitate staff orientation and induction programs to ensure smooth integration of new employees into the organization.
	Maintain recruitment trackers and ensure timely closure of vacancies, especially for operational roles such as kitchen staff, service staff, front desk, and housekeeping.


Employee Relations & Workforce Support:


	Serve as the first point of contact for employees on HR-related matters including welfare, leave, attendance, disciplinary issues, and general workplace concerns.
	Assist in handling grievances and disciplinary cases in a fair, consistent, and confidential manner in line with company policy and labor laws.
	Support management in promoting positive employee relations and maintaining a healthy workplace culture.
	Participate in staff engagement initiatives, welfare programs, and internal communication activities.
	Support exit processes including resignation handling, exit interviews, and clearance documentation.


HR Administration & Records Management:


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records, both physical and electronic, including contracts, personal data, performance records, and disciplinary history.
	Manage employee attendance, leave records, shift schedules (where applicable), and staff documentation.
	Ensure proper filing, data protection, and confidentiality of all employee information.
	Prepare monthly HR reports such as headcount, staff turnover, recruitment status, and absenteeism.
	Support the preparation and updating of employee handbooks, HR policies, and standard operating procedures.


Payroll & Compliance Support:


	Work closely with the finance/payroll team to provide accurate staff data, time sheets, overtime records, and leave information for payroll processing.
	Support statutory compliance relating to labor regulations, employment contracts, and workplace standards.
	Assist with regulatory inspections or audits when required.
	Ensure HR practices align with internal policies and applicable labor laws.


Performance Management & Training Support:


	Assist in coordinating performance appraisal cycles and ensuring documentation is properly completed and filed.
	Support supervisors and managers with performance improvement plans where necessary.
	Assist in identifying training needs and coordinating internal or external training programs.
	Maintain training records and evaluate training effectiveness where required.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree or HND in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, Industrial Relations, or a related discipline.
	Minimum of 2 years of proven experience in an HR or administrative HR role.
	Experience in the restaurant or hotel industry is an added advantage but not compulsory.
	Basic understanding of labor laws, employee relations practices, and HR operations.
	Strong organizational and documentation skills with high attention to detail.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
	Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with integrity and professionalism.
	Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, operational environment with diverse staff categories.
